thread.title: Jabari Parker suffers left knee injury on non-contact drive to the basket
thread.title_full: Jabari Parker suffers left knee injury on non-contact drive to the basket

author: Tim Cato
title: Jabari Parker suffers left knee injury on non-contact drive to the basket
text:
This looks like a terrible injury for Parker and the Bucks.
Jabari Parker was helped to the locker room by teammates after his left knee buckled on a drive to the basket. The non-contact injury happened to the same knee that Parker suffered an torn ACL to in Jan. 2015, and it’s a very bad sign that he wasn’t able to put weigh on it leaving the game.
The Milwaukee Bucks officially announced the injury as a sprained knee and said Parker will not return, per their Twitter. 
Here’s video of the injury. You can clearly see Parker plant, his knee give way and him react in pain.
Parker played nearly all of his sophomore season, suiting up for 76 games during a healthy season after recovering from the torn ACL. Parker was having his best season as a pro this year, playing in 50 games and averaging slight more than 20 points per game.
The timing could not be more unfortunate, with Khris Middleton — who was injured before the year — making his return this game and the Bucks looking forwards to finally fielding a healthy roster again.
